achievements.title: Edge Enrichment at Massive Scale
achievements.context: Adobe was modernizing its data collection infrastructure through Experience Edge. Multiple Adobe products (CJA, Adobe Analytics, AEP) needed enrichment services for incoming data, but each team was building their own solutions, leading to duplicated effort and inconsistent results.
achievements.problem: We needed centralized, high-performance enrichment services (geo lookup, bot detection, device lookup) that could handle tens of billions of requests per day with single-digit millisecond latency while maintaining SLAs for downstream systems. The challenge was building shared infrastructure that would work across multiple Adobe products with different requirements.
actions: Led the initiative to design and build three enrichment services on Adobe Experience Edge
Evaluated third-party vendors to determine the best functionality and cost trade-offs
Drove cross-functional alignment across multiple Adobe businesses (CJA, AA, AEP) and technical teams
Defined feature set and SLA requirements that balanced competing priorities
Navigated complex shared infrastructure discussions, persuading teams to adopt approaches that would impact their users

quantitative: Handled tens of billions of lookups per day
qualitative: Multiple Adobe businesses successfully consuming the service
Eliminated duplicated vendor relationships
Reduced overall costs
Improved data consistency across products

achievements.story: This project taught me how to balance the needs of multiple stakeholders with different priorities. The key was focusing on shared infrastructure benefits while being transparent about trade-offs. I learned that sometimes slowing down to build consensus upfront leads to faster execution later.
achievements.reflection: This project taught me how to balance the needs of multiple stakeholders with different priorities. The key was focusing on shared infrastructure benefits while being transparent about trade-offs. I learned that sometimes slowing down to build consensus upfront leads to faster execution later.

achievements.title: Privacy & Cookieless Tracking Thought Leadership
achievements.context: Privacy limitations and regulations were proliferating impacting the ability of our customers to collect usage data and thus their ability to use Adobe Analytics reporting to make business decisions. There were a variety of changes with plenty of nuances.
achievements.problem: Customers were concerned about their ability to collect data and how this would impact their ability to use Analytics reporting on site/app usage to make business decisions. There was plenty of complexity which lead to confusion and concern. This in turn threatened to undermine the value of Adobe's solutions.
actions: Established myself as the go-to expert on privacy and cookieless tracking, creating resources that empowered customers to assess and adapt to changes
Created comprehensive documentation and customer presentations that clarified complex privacy changes and their implications

Designed a pre-built reporting template that leveraged Adobe Analytics' own capabilities to measure the specific impact on each customer's data, showing identity reset patterns and visitor behavior changes
Built enablement materials for sales and customer-facing teams, including training sessions and knowledge transfer

The reporting template used Analytics' strengths to show how often visitors returned later than 7 days, which under Safari's ITP limitations would reset user identity and cause them to be treated as new users with no history

quantitative: 2 live presentations at Adobe Summit to a total audience of about 1000
Collateral created for sales and other customer facing teams along with training and knowledge transfer
qualitative: Highlighted the power of existing product, provided clarity of the impact which end users could share with their stakeholders
Usually the impact was less than customers had feared
Showed how customers could use reporting to adjust for the impacts of these changes to the data

achievements.story: This experience taught me that customers are hungry for guidance in navigating challenges in their space. Acting as a trusted advisor and partner is essential in B2B relationships. I learned that combining education with practical, actionable tools (like the reporting template) has more impact than documentation alone. The work demonstrated the value of becoming a subject matter expert and using that expertise to enable customers and internal teams at scale.
achievements.reflection: This experience taught me that customers are hungry for guidance in navigating challenges in their space. Acting as a trusted advisor and partner is essential in B2B relationships. I learned that combining education with practical, actionable tools (like the reporting template) has more impact than documentation alone. The work demonstrated the value of becoming a subject matter expert and using that expertise to enable customers and internal teams at scale.

achievements.title: CJA Migration Strategy
achievements.context: Adobe was transitioning customers from legacy Adobe Analytics to the modern Customer Journey Analytics (CJA) platform. This required careful planning to balance speed of migration with quality of implementation.
achievements.problem: How to migrate customers from Adobe Analytics to CJA efficiently while balancing quick-and-dirty approaches against slow-and-clean implementations. Needed to navigate complex shared infrastructure and persuade platform teams to adopt approaches that would impact other users.
actions: Led strategic planning for customer migration from Adobe Analytics to Customer Journey Analytics
Balanced trade-offs between quick-and-dirty vs. slow-and-clean migration approaches
Navigated complex shared infrastructure requirements, persuading platform teams to adopt approaches that would impact other users
Developed multiple time-to-value (TTV) projects to accelerate customer adoption
Explored AI-driven solutions for migration assistance, including understanding customer jobs-to-be-done and pain points

qualitative: Established strategic framework for customer migration
Accelerated time-to-value for customer adoption
Successfully navigated complex cross-team dependencies

achievements.problem: Customers needed to map business rules to XDM schema to use CJA, but this required significant technical expertise and time. This barrier to entry was slowing adoption and creating friction in the customer journey.
actions: Led initiative to map business rules to XDM schema, dramatically reducing time-to-value for CJA adoption
Lowered technical expertise and time required for customers to get set up on CJA
Applied solution across four distinct use cases: new AEM customers, new CJA customers, existing CJA customers, and Content Analytics
Developed streamlined onboarding workflows for ACA and AEM customers

quantitative: Applied across four distinct customer use cases
qualitative: Dramatically reduced time-to-value for CJA adoption
Lowered technical expertise barrier
Streamlined onboarding for multiple customer segments
